term.title: carbon artifact

item.text: An 'artificially produced' solid body which consists mainly of carbonaceous material in a distinct shape.

notes.item: Sometimes this term is also used for artificially (in the sense of technically) produced non-shaped carbon materials such as coke, blacks, etc. This application of the term carbon artifact is not recommended. Synonyms to the term carbon artifact are: 'artificial carbon article' or 'artificial carbon body'.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 479 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
